question:
Which of the following is NOT an alkaline earth metal?

SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (1st shift)
solution:
• The element that is NOT an alkaline earth metal is Na (Sodium).
  • Sodium (Na) belongs to the alkali metals group (Group 1).
  • Magnesium (Mg), Calcium (Ca), and Beryllium (Be) are alkaline earth metals (Group 2).
  • Alkaline earth metals are characterized by having two electrons in their outermost shell.

Additional Information:

  • Alkali metals (like Na) are more reactive and softer compared to alkaline earth metals.
  • Alkaline earth metals have higher melting points and are less reactive than alkali metals.

question:
What is the name of the seventh most abundant metal in the earth’s crust, which is derived from the medieval Latinword ‘Kalium’?

SSC MTS 01/09/2023 (1st shift)
solution:
• The seventh most abundant metal in the Earth's crust derived from the medieval Latin word ‘Kalium’ is Potassium.
  • The chemical symbol for Potassium is K, which comes from ‘Kalium’.
  • Potassium is essential for plant and animal life and is found in minerals like potash.
  • Aluminium, magnesium, and calcium are other abundant metals but are not related to the word ‘Kalium’.

Additional Information:

  • Potassium is highly reactive and does not occur free in nature.
  • It plays a vital role in biological functions, especially in nerve transmission.

question:
Which chemical element with atomic number 35 has a dark reddish-brown liquid with a burning pungent odour?

SSC MTS 06/09/2023 (1st shift)
solution:
• The chemical element with atomic number 35 is Bromine (not Chlorine).
  • Bromine is a dark reddish-brown liquid at room temperature and has a strong, pungent, and burning odor.
  • Chlorine (atomic number 17) is a greenish-yellow gas with a sharp smell.
  • Tennessine (atomic number 117) and Astatine (atomic number 85) have different properties and are not commonly encountered.

Additional Information:

  • Bromine is used in flame retardants, dyes, and pharmaceuticals.
  • It is one of the only two elements that are liquid at room temperature (the other is mercury).

question:
An Image of which of the following elements is shown by the map of Cyprus from which the element got its name?

SSC MTS 13/09/2023 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The element named after the map of Cyprus is Copper.
  • The name "Copper" is derived from the Latin word "Cuprum", which comes from "Cyprium", meaning "metal of Cyprus."
  • Cyprus was historically famous for its rich copper deposits.
  • Silver, cobalt, and sulphur have different etymologies unrelated to Cyprus.

Additional Information:

  • Copper is one of the oldest metals used by humans.
  • It is widely used in electrical wiring, plumbing, and coins.

question:
Which radioactive isotope has a half-life of 5770 years, which is commonly used to estimate the age of organic materials such as paper and parchment?

SSC MTS 13/09/2023 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The radioactive isotope with a half-life of approximately 5770 years, used for dating organic materials, is Carbon-14 (¹⁴C).
  • Carbon-14 dating is commonly used to estimate the age of ancient organic objects like paper, parchment, fossils, and archaeological samples.
  • ⁹C, ¹²C, and ¹⁷C are not radioactive isotopes or are stable isotopes of carbon.

Additional Information:

  • Carbon-14 is produced in the upper atmosphere and incorporated into living organisms.
  • After death, the ¹⁴C starts to decay, allowing scientists to estimate the time elapsed.

question:
Which metal ion released form the tannery industry causes acute water pollution?

SSC CHSL 09/08/2023 (1st shift)
solution:
• The metal ion released from the tannery industry that causes acute water pollution is Chromium (Cr).
  • Chromium, especially in its hexavalent form (Cr⁶⁺), is highly toxic and carcinogenic.
  • It contaminates water bodies near tannery effluents, causing severe environmental and health hazards.
  • Magnesium (Mg), Arsenic (As), and Zinc (Zn) may also be pollutants but are less commonly associated with tannery waste.

Additional Information:

  • Proper treatment of tannery wastewater is essential to remove chromium.
  • Chromium pollution affects aquatic life and can cause skin diseases in humans.

question:
What is the most stable mineral during he process of weathering?

SSC CHSL 10/08/2023 (1st shift)
solution:
• The most stable mineral during the process of weathering is Quartz.
  • Quartz is highly resistant to chemical weathering due to its strong silicon-oxygen bonds.
  • Minerals like olivine, pyroxene, and amphibole are less stable and weather more quickly.
  • Quartz often remains as a residual mineral after other minerals have decomposed.

Additional Information:

  • Quartz is abundant in sand and sedimentary rocks.
  • Its durability makes it important in soil formation and sediment transport.

question:
From which Latin word is the s block element calcium derived?

SSC CGL 14/07/2023 (3rd shift)
solution:
• The s-block element Calcium is derived from the Latin word "Calx".
  • "Calx" means lime or limestone in Latin, which is the common source of calcium.
  • The other options, Calum, Coleus, and Calcio, are incorrect origins.

Additional Information:

  • Calcium is essential for bones and teeth in living organisms.
  • It is widely used in construction and metallurgy.

question:
Which element of Group 17 has two isotopes of masses 35 and 37 amu with average abundance of 75.77% and 24.23%, respectively?

SSC CGL 17/07/2023 (1st shift)
solution:
• The Group 17 element with two isotopes of masses 35 amu and 37 amu, having average abundances of 75.77% and 24.23% respectively, is Chlorine.
  • These isotopes are Cl-35 and Cl-37.
  • Chlorine’s atomic mass is calculated based on these isotope abundances.
  • Iodine, fluorine, and astatine have different isotopic compositions.

Additional Information:

  • Chlorine is widely used in disinfectants, bleach, and PVC production.
  • The isotopic distribution affects the atomic weight of chlorine.

question:
Which of the following are metalloids?

SSC CGL 18/07/2023 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The correct metalloids among the options are Boron, Silicon, and Antimony.
  • Metalloids have properties intermediate between metals and non-metals.
  • Boron (B), Silicon (Si), and Antimony (Sb) are well-known metalloids.
  • Oxygen, aluminium, mercury, iron, and copper are either non-metals or metals, not metalloids.

Additional Information:

  • Metalloids are used in semiconductors and electronics.
  • Their physical and chemical properties vary between metals and non-metals.

question:
Which among the following alloys is a combination of gold and silver?

SSC MTS 10/05/2023 (Evening)
solution:
• The alloy that is a combination of gold and silver is Electrum.
  • Electrum is a naturally occurring alloy of gold and silver, sometimes with trace amounts of other metals.
  • Bronze is primarily copper and tin.
  • Constantan is an alloy of copper and nickel.
  • Solder is typically an alloy of tin and lead or other metals.

Additional Information:

  • Electrum was used historically for coins and jewelry.
  • Its color varies from pale to bright yellow depending on the gold content.

question:
Which of the following is a non-metal that can exist in different form?

SSC MTS 12/05/2023 (1st shift)
solution:
• The non-metal that can exist in different forms (allotropes) is Carbon.
  • Carbon exists in several allotropes such as diamond, graphite, graphene, and fullerenes.
  • Mercury, lithium, and potassium are metals and do not have allotropes.

Additional Information:

  • Different allotropes of carbon have vastly different physical properties.
  • Diamond is hard and transparent, while graphite is soft and conducts electricity.

question:
What is the characteristic of isotopes?

SSC MTS 18/05/2023 (2nd shift)
option_1: Same neutron and same proton
option_2: Same atomic number and different mass number
option_3: Same atomic number and same mass number
option_4: Same neutron and different proton
solution:
• The characteristic of isotopes is that they have the same atomic number but different mass numbers.
  • This means isotopes have the same number of protons but different numbers of neutrons.
  • Options like "same neutron and same proton" or "same neutron and different proton" are incorrect.
  • Having the same atomic number and mass number means they are identical atoms, not isotopes.

Additional Information:

  • Isotopes of an element exhibit similar chemical properties but different physical properties.
  • Examples include Carbon-12 and Carbon-14.

question:
Which of the following metals is always a component in an amalgam?

SSC MTS 15/06/2023 (1st shift)
solution:
• The metal that is always a component in an amalgam is Mercury.
  • An amalgam is an alloy of mercury with another metal or metals.
  • Strontium, zinc, and aluminium do not form amalgams by themselves.
  • Mercury’s unique ability to form alloys with many metals makes it essential for amalgams.

Additional Information:

  • Dental amalgams, used for fillings, commonly contain mercury.
  • Amalgams are used in various industrial applications due to mercury’s properties.

question:
Oxides of ______ and ______ dissolve in rain water and form acids which are called acid rain.

SSC MTS 16/06/2023 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The oxides of Sulphur and Nitrogen dissolve in rainwater and form acids, which cause acid rain.
  • Sulphur oxides form sulfurous and sulfuric acids, while nitrogen oxides form nitric acid in the atmosphere.
  • Phosphorous and sulphur oxides, carbon dioxide and methane, calcium and magnesium oxides do not primarily cause acid rain.

Additional Information:

  • Acid rain damages plants, aquatic life, and corrodes buildings.
  • Major sources include fossil fuel combustion and vehicle emissions.

question:
Which among the following alloys is made up of copper and zinc?

SSC CHSL 13/03/2023 (3rd shift)
solution:
• The alloy made up of copper and zinc is Dutch Metal.
  • Dutch Metal is a type of brass, an alloy primarily composed of copper and zinc.
  • Monel metal is an alloy of nickel and copper.
  • Magnalium is an alloy of magnesium and aluminum.
  • Rolled gold is a thin layer of gold mechanically bonded to a base metal, not a specific alloy of copper and zinc.

Additional Information:

  • Dutch Metal is used in decorative items due to its gold-like appearance.
  • Brass alloys vary in the ratio of copper and zinc for different properties.

question:
Which of the following statements is correct?

SSC CHSL 14/03/2023 (3rd shift)
option_1: Metals react with acids and produce metal salt and hydrogen gas
option_2: Non – metals react with oxygen to produce non – metallic oxides which are basic in nature
option_3: On burning, metals react with oxygen to produce metal oxides which are acidic in nature
option_4: Less reactive metals displace more reactive metals from their compounds in aqueous solutions
solution:
• The correct statement is (a) Metals react with acids and produce metal salt and hydrogen gas.
  • When metals like zinc, magnesium, or iron react with acids, they form corresponding metal salts and release hydrogen gas.
  • Statement (b) is incorrect because non-metal oxides are generally acidic, not basic.
  • Statement (c) is incorrect because metal oxides are usually basic or amphoteric, not acidic.
  • Statement (d) is incorrect because more reactive metals displace less reactive metals from their compounds, not the other way around.

Additional Information:

  • This reaction is commonly used in laboratories to produce hydrogen gas.
  • Reactivity series determines displacement reactions.

question:
Which of the following statements is/are NOT correct?

i. The property of metals by which they can be beaten into thin sheets is called malleability.

ii. The property of metal by which it can being drawn into wires is called ductility.

SSC CHSL 21/03/2023 (4th shift)
option_1: Neither I nor II
option_2: Both I and II
solution:
• Both statements i and ii are correct, so the answer is (a) Neither I nor II is incorrect.
  • Malleability is the property of metals that allows them to be beaten into thin sheets.
  • Ductility is the property that allows metals to be drawn into wires.
  • Therefore, neither of the statements is incorrect.

Additional Information:

  • These properties are characteristic of most metals.
  • They contribute to the usefulness of metals in manufacturing and construction.

question:
Which of the following liquids can dissolve noble metals such as gold and platinum?

SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The liquid that can dissolve noble metals such as gold and platinum is Aqua Regia.
  • Aqua regia is a mixture of concentrated nitric acid and hydrochloric acid in a 1:3 ratio.
  • It is one of the few substances capable of dissolving gold and platinum.
  • Formic acid, acetic acid, and chloroform cannot dissolve these noble metals.

Additional Information:

  • Aqua regia is used in refining and analytical chemistry to dissolve precious metals.
  • It produces chlorine and nitrosyl chloride during the reaction.

question:
Which of the following statements is NOT correct regardingthe alkali metals?

SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (2nd shift)
option_1: All the alkali metals are silvery white, soft and light metals
option_2: The ionization enthalpies of the alkali metals are considerably low and decrease down the group from
option_3: Group 1 metals are known as alkali metals
option_4: All the alkali metals have two valence electros
solution:
• The incorrect statement regarding alkali metals is (d) All the alkali metals have two valence electrons.
  • Alkali metals belong to Group 1 and have only one valence electron.
  • Statements (a), (b), and (c) are correct:
    • Alkali metals are silvery white, soft, and light.
    • Their ionization enthalpies are low and decrease down the group.
    • Group 1 metals are called alkali metals.

Additional Information:

  • The single valence electron makes alkali metals highly reactive.
  • These metals readily lose one electron to form +1 ions.

question:
Which of the following statements in INCORRECT?

SSC MTS 11/07/2023 (1st shift)
option_1: Metals are used in making cookware
option_2: Metals are used in the manufacture of automobiles
option_3: Living Beings inhale metals during respiration
option_4: Metals are used in manufacturing jewellery
solution:
• The incorrect statement is (c) Living beings inhale metals during respiration.
  • Living beings inhale gases like oxygen and nitrogen, not metals.
  • Statements (a), (b), and (d) are correct:
    • Metals are used to make cookware because of their heat conductivity.
    • Metals are essential in automobile manufacturing.
    • Metals are widely used in jewelry making due to their luster and durability.

Additional Information:

  • Inhalation of metals as particulates can be harmful but is not part of normal respiration.
  • Metals play a crucial role in many industries and daily life.

question:
Choose the most reactive metal from the options given below.

SSC MTS 06/07/2022 (1st shift)
solution:
• The most reactive metal among the given options is Sodium (Na).
  • Sodium is an alkali metal known for its high reactivity, especially with water and oxygen.
  • Copper, zinc, and iron are less reactive metals compared to sodium.
  • Reactivity of metals generally increases as you move down Group 1 in the periodic table.

Additional Information:

  • Sodium reacts vigorously with water to produce sodium hydroxide and hydrogen gas.
  • Due to its high reactivity, sodium is stored under oil to prevent reaction with moisture.

question:
Which of the following statements is INCORRECT?

SSC MTS 15/07/2022 (2nd shift)
option_1: Metals react with oxygen to form basic oxides
option_2: Non – metals are malleable
option_3: Non – metals do not produce any sound
option_4: Metals have low ionisation enthalpy
solution:
• The incorrect statement is (b) Non-metals are malleable.
  • Non-metals are generally brittle and not malleable.
  • Statement (a) is correct: metals react with oxygen to form basic oxides.
  • Statement (c) is generally true: non-metals do not produce sound when struck.
  • Statement (d) is correct: metals have low ionization enthalpy compared to non-metals.

Additional Information:

  • Malleability is a property of metals allowing them to be hammered into thin sheets.
  • Non-metals lack this property and usually break or crumble under stress.

question:
Which of the following metals reacts violently with cold water?

SSC MTS 25/07/2022 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The metal that reacts violently with cold water is Potassium (K).
  • Potassium is an alkali metal and is highly reactive, especially with water.
  • When potassium comes into contact with cold water, it reacts vigorously, producing potassium hydroxide and hydrogen gas, often with flames.
  • Magnesium, aluminium, and zinc react slowly or not noticeably with cold water.

Additional Information:

  • Alkali metals like potassium and sodium react more violently as we move down the group.
  • Due to high reactivity, potassium must be stored under oil to prevent accidental contact with moisture.

question:
Which of the following metals having atomic number 3 is a soft, silvery metal with very low density that reacts vigorously with water and corrodes quickly in air?

SSC CHSL 24/05/2022 (1st shift)
solution:
• The metal with atomic number 3 is Lithium (Li).
  • Lithium is a soft, silvery-white metal with very low density.
  • It reacts vigorously with water and corrodes quickly when exposed to air.
  • Potassium, sodium, and rubidium have different atomic numbers (19, 11, and 37 respectively) and similar but not identical properties.

Additional Information:

  • Lithium is the lightest metal and is used in batteries and alloys.
  • It must be stored carefully to avoid rapid oxidation.

question:
Identify the INCORRECT pair with respect to the substance and their specific heat capacity (Jkg-1K-1) at room temperature and atmospheric pressure.

(Jkg-1K-1)

SSC CHSL 26/05/2022 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The incorrect pair is (b) Water – 1200 Jkg⁻¹K⁻¹.
  • The specific heat capacity of water at room temperature is approximately 4186 Jkg⁻¹K⁻¹, much higher than 1200.
  • Other values are approximately correct:
    • Aluminium: ~900 Jkg⁻¹K⁻¹
    • Carbon (graphite): ~506.5 Jkg⁻¹K⁻¹
    • Tungsten: ~134 Jkg⁻¹K⁻¹

Additional Information:

  • Water has one of the highest specific heat capacities among common substances.
  • This property makes water effective for heat regulation and cooling.

question:
The particles of which metal on heating to the boiling point of 357C go from liquid state to gas state?

SSC CHSL 26/05/2022 (2nd shift)


https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1750222974934_image001.png
solution:
• The metal that vaporizes (goes from liquid to gas) on heating to its boiling point of 357°C is Mercury.
  • Mercury is unique among metals because it is liquid at room temperature.
  • Copper and gallium have much higher boiling points.
  • Bronze is an alloy, not a pure metal, and has a high boiling point.

Additional Information:

  • Mercury’s low boiling point makes it useful in thermometers and other instruments.
  • It vaporizes easily compared to most metals.

question:
The name of which element is derived from an Anglo-Saxon word and its symbol comes from the Latin word ‘Aurum’?

SSC CHSL 31/05/2022 (Evening)
solution:
• The element whose name is derived from an Anglo-Saxon word and whose symbol comes from the Latin word "Aurum" is Gold.
  • Gold's chemical symbol is Au, taken from the Latin word "Aurum" meaning "shining dawn" or "glow of sunrise".
  • Argon, aluminium, and silver have different origins and symbols.

Additional Information:

  • Gold has been known and valued since ancient times.
  • It is widely used in jewelry, electronics, and as a standard for monetary systems.

question:
Which metal sulphate, composed of potassium, aluminium, and sulphate ions in the ratio 1 : 1 : 2, plays a role as a flame retardant, a mordant and an astringent?

SSC CHSL 31/05/2022 (Evening)
solution:
• The metal sulphate composed of potassium, aluminium, and sulphate ions in the ratio 1 : 1 : 2 is Potash alum.
  • Potash alum (potassium aluminium sulfate) is widely used as a flame retardant, mordant in dyeing, and as an astringent in medicine.
  • Gypsum is calcium sulfate, Epsom salts are magnesium sulfate, and Celestite is strontium sulfate.

Additional Information:

  • Potash alum is also used in water purification and as a deodorant.
  • Its astringent property helps in reducing bleeding from minor cuts.

question:
Ozone is an allotrope of ______ .

SSC CGL 12/04/2022 (1st shift)
solution:
• Ozone is an allotrope of Oxygen.
  • It consists of three oxygen atoms (O₃) bonded together, unlike the normal oxygen molecule (O₂).
  • Carbon dioxide, hydrogen, and nitrogen do not have ozone as their allotrope.

Additional Information:

  • Ozone plays a crucial role in protecting the Earth from harmful ultraviolet rays.
  • It is found naturally in the ozone layer of the stratosphere.

question:
How many protons are there in a lithium nucleus?

SSC CGL 18/04/2022 (Evening)
solution:
• The number of protons in a lithium nucleus is 3.
  • The atomic number of lithium is 3, which equals the number of protons.
  • Options 2, 4, and 5 are incorrect.

Additional Information:

  • The number of protons determines the identity of an element.
  • Lithium has 3 protons and typically 3 or 4 neutrons in its nucleus.

question:
Which of the following is a low-grade brown coal that is soft with high moisture content?

SSC MTS 11/10/2021 (1st shift)
solution:
• The low-grade brown coal that is soft and has high moisture content is Lignite.
  • Lignite is considered the lowest rank of coal due to its lower carbon content and high moisture.
  • Bituminous coal and anthracite are higher grades of coal with higher carbon content and less moisture.
  • Peat is a precursor to coal but is not classified as coal itself.

Additional Information:

  • Lignite is primarily used as a fuel in power plants near mining sites.
  • Its high moisture content makes it less efficient compared to higher-grade coals.

question:
Which of the followings is a property of silicon dioxide?

SSC MTS 11/10/2021 (Evening)
option_3: It is soluble in water
option_4: It has a high melting point
solution:
• The correct property of silicon dioxide (SiO₂) is (d) It has a high melting point.
  • Silicon dioxide has a very high melting point due to its strong covalent bonds in a giant lattice structure.
  • It does not conduct electricity (option a), is hard rather than soft (option b), and is insoluble in water (option c).

Additional Information:

  • Silicon dioxide is commonly found in sand and quartz.
  • Its high melting point makes it useful in glass and ceramics manufacturing.

question:
Which of the following minerals has kieserite as its ore?

SSC MTS 12/10/2021 (1st shift)
solution:
• The mineral Magnesium has Kieserite as its ore.
  • Kieserite is magnesium sulfate monohydrate (MgSO₄·H₂O), an important source of magnesium.
  • Silver, potassium, and iron have different ores.

Additional Information:

  • Kieserite is commonly found in evaporite deposits.
  • It is used in fertilizers and various industrial applications.

question:
Identify the alloy among the following of which lead is a component.

SSC MTS 26/10/2021 (1st shift)
solution:
• The alloy among the given options that contains lead as a component is Solder.
  • Solder is typically an alloy of tin and lead used to join metal parts.
  • Alnico is an alloy of aluminum, nickel, and cobalt.
  • Nickel and Constantan are different alloys without lead.

Additional Information:

  • Solder melts at a relatively low temperature, making it useful in electronics and plumbing.
  • Lead in solder improves its melting properties and flow.

question:
Which of the following is one of the metals used in LED semiconductor technology?

SSC CGL 16/08/2021 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The metal used in LED semiconductor technology is Gallium.
  • Gallium is a key component in compounds like gallium arsenide (GaAs) and gallium nitride (GaN), which are widely used in LEDs.
  • Iron, copper, and zinc are not commonly used in LED semiconductor materials.

Additional Information:

  • Gallium-based semiconductors have high efficiency and brightness.
  • LEDs made with gallium compounds are used in displays, lighting, and communication devices.

question:
Which of the following metals reacts with the moist carbon dioxide in the air and slowly loses its shiny brown surface and gains a green coat?

SSC CHSL 16/04/2021 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The metal that reacts with moist carbon dioxide in the air and gradually loses its shiny brown surface to form a green coating is Copper.
  • This green coating is known as patina, mainly consisting of basic copper carbonate formed due to the reaction of copper with carbon dioxide and moisture.
  • Silver, iron, and zinc do not form a green coat under these conditions.
  • Iron typically forms rust (reddish-brown iron oxide), while silver tarnishes forming black silver sulfide.

Additional Information:

  • Copper’s green patina actually protects the metal beneath from further corrosion.
  • This is commonly seen in old copper roofs, statues, and coins.
  • The process is a form of corrosion, but unlike rusting, the patina layer acts as a protective barrier.

question:
Which one of the following features is NOT shown by metals?

SSC CHSL 09/08/2021 (1st shift)
option_2: Can be pounded into shape
option_3: Can be made into a wire
solution:
• Metals generally do not look dull; they have a shiny or lustrous appearance.
  • They can be pounded into shapes (malleability).
  • Metals can be drawn into wires (ductility).
  • Metals are good conductors of heat.
  • Therefore, the feature “Looks dull” is NOT typical of metals.

Additional Information:

  • The lustrous appearance is a key property of metals.
  • Metals also have other properties like high density, high melting point, and electrical conductivity.
  • Non-metals usually have dull appearances, unlike metals.

question:
What is the Atomic Number of the element Einsteinium?

SSC CPO 23/11/2020 (1st shift)
solution:
• The atomic number of Einsteinium is 99.
  • Einsteinium is a synthetic element in the actinide series, named after Albert Einstein.
  • It is a radioactive metal and does not occur naturally.
  • The atomic number represents the number of protons in the nucleus of the element.

Additional Information:

  • Einsteinium is placed after Californium (98) and before Fermium (100) in the periodic table.
  • It was first discovered in the debris of a thermonuclear explosion in 1952.

question:
Which of the following is an example of a pair of Isobars?

SSC CHSL 17/03/2020 (Evening)
solution:
• Isobars are atoms of different elements having the same mass number but different atomic numbers.
  • Calcium (Ca) has atomic number 20 and mass number 40.
  • Argon (Ar) has atomic number 18 and mass number 40.
  • Since both have the same mass number (40) but different atomic numbers, they are isobars.
  • Other pairs do not share the same mass number.

Additional Information:

  • Isobars differ in chemical properties as they belong to different elements.
  • Isotopes, in contrast, have the same atomic number but different mass numbers.
  • Isotones have the same number of neutrons but different atomic numbers.
